definition: Tojo Hideki (1884-1948), Japanese military leader hanged as war criminal in 1948
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

sentences.english: But the minister of war was an expansionist, General Tojo.
sentences.chinese: 但战争部长是一个扩张主义，东条英机通用。

definition: Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
Prince KONOE Fumimaro (1891-), Japanese nobleman and militarist politician, prime minister 1937-1939 and 1940-1941
ITŌ Hirobumi (1841-1909), Japanese Meiji restoration politician, prime minister on four occasions, influential in Japanese expansionism in Korea, assassinated in Harbin
General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Benito Mussolini (1883-1945), Italian fascist dictator, "Il Duce", president 1922-1943
